alert.note: Alert for Eastern Ulster; Western Ulster (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albany (Eastern New York and Western New England)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 25 at 1:02PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Ulster and south central Greene Counties through 145 PM EDT... At 102 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Mount Tremper, or 14 miles west of Kingston, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Saugerties, Woodstock, West Hurley, West Shokan, Kenneth L Wilson Campground, Mount Tremper, Olivebridge, Phoenicia, Veteran, Centerville, Ashokan, Canoe Hill, Glenford, Shultis Corners, Pacama, Brodhead, Blue Mountain, Zena, Montoma and Morgan Hill. This includes Interstate 87 near exit 20. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
